lexUnit.name: awaken.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stop or cause to stop sleeping.

sentence.text: A tug at his trouser leg awakened him from his reverie .
` Awaken us from this nightmare , Huy .
The next day , Nichols awakened Turman with an early morning call .
We were awakened the next morning by Sir Henry Bowyer 's rough arrival accompanied by at least a dozen likely-looking rogues .
She was awakened some time later by the sound of Fen 's voice and his hand briefly shaking her by the shoulder .
The phones ringing on each floor must have awakened Anna , for she could hear bare feet padding overhead .
Her shriek awakened the house , and Coleridge , who had been asleep when his father returned , knew at once what it signified , saying to himself in the darkness , ` Papa is dead . "
The whole house was quiet and she told herself that she must be careful not to awaken the two other sleeping inhabitants .
I was awakened by a French Commando nudging me in the ribs with the toe of his boot .
The drama began when a neighbour was awakened by the dead man 's wife .
I am awakened by the cramps .
I staggered off to sleep and was awakened by my master , his face bathed in a pool of candle light .
By the time Andrew was awakened by his sister Gillian Parry battering on the door of the house in Newton Street , Southport after calling in on her way to work , the lounge was burning fiercely .
I was awakened around noon by the Sergeant who was in command of yesterday evening 's patrol .
Neighbours were awakened at about 11.45pm by screams for help .
I was awakened shortly after dawn by Floss and Tibbs .
So , once again , Anabelle was awakened in the middle of her sleep by the buzz of loud voices outside the nest .
I did so , and seeing I was of no more use , I rushed inside to awaken my older brother and sister to show them what had happened .
Because when you 're awakened by somebody else 's involuntary noise , you first feel sympathy , then irritation , followed by impotent fury then tears of frustration .
I suspect that on the night of the Olympic final all the neighbours were rudely awakened at 4 a.m .
